featured.text: Everyone starts and ends the day by howling to check out where their nearest competitors are.
He had to check whether his tape-recorder was working.
In the future when the population grows, there will be no need for the recording because the howler monkeys will have more reason to check in with the neighbors to define their own territories.
I’ll check the FAX office right away.

other.text: Why did the architect send Jack a blank check? (A)
One oil company offered him $2000 for his help and an architect even sent him a blank check.
Dead mail will also be listed on a computer so that people can call in and check to see if a missing item is there.
Red is a popular color, and women generally opt for checked, striped, or patterned pieces of cloth.

definition.zh_def: 檢查，確認或驗證某事物的正確性或狀態。
definition.en_def: To examine something in order to determine its accuracy, quality, or condition.
definition.example: Please check your answers before submitting the test.
